definition: an idea or opinion that is considered socially unacceptable or criminal
a sudden feeling of great fear that cannot be controlled and prevents you from thinking clearly
a situation in which people are made to feel very anxious or frightened, causing them to act quickly and without thinking carefully
a situation in which people feel very anxious and there is a lot of confused activity, especially because there is a lot to do in a short period of time
a type of strong rough brown cloth, used especially for making sacks
a hard bread roll in the shape of a ring
full of anger and excitement
made warmer using a heater
one of a pair of small objects used for fastening shirt cuffs together
a person who has done something wrong or against the law
a person or thing responsible for causing a problem
a way of life, an attitude, an idea, etc. that has become very popular
a small group of people who have extreme religious beliefs and who are not part of any established religion
a system of religious beliefs and practices
having a high level of education and showing good manners
used to grow crops
grown on a farm, etc. in order to be sold
to officially state that somebody is not responsible for something that they have been blamed for
well educated and able to understand and enjoy art, literature, etc.
grown for medical or scientific study
grown artificially
to obtain or collect something such as information, support, etc.
having a result that increases in strength or importance each time more of something is added
including all the amounts that have been added previously
able to get what you want in a clever way, especially by tricking or cheating somebody
clever and showing skill
that can be cured
able to cure illness
a belief or set of beliefs held by a group or organization that others are expected to accept without argument
to make a person or an animal healthy again after an illness
to make an illness go away
to deal with a problem successfully
to stop somebody from behaving in a particular way, especially a way that is bad or annoying
to treat food or tobacco with smoke, salt or heat, etc. in order to preserve it
used to say that what you are going to do will either be very successful or fail completely
a way of dealing with or improving an unpleasant or difficult situation
a treatment or medicine to cure a disease or reduce pain that is not very serious
a way of dealing with a problem, using the processes of the law
a small object that is rare or unusual, often something that people collect
the act of starting to use a computer system or online account, usually by typing a name or word that you choose to use
the name that you use to enter a computer system or online account
to perform the actions that allow you to begin using a computer system, application or online account
to allow somebody to begin using a computer system, application or online account
being certain that your beliefs are right and that others should accept them, without paying attention to evidence or other opinions
the fact of being useful or possible to use
a strong desire to know about something
an unusual and interesting thing
used to tell somebody not to ask questions or try to find out about things that do not involve them
a strong interest in learning about many different things
a desire to find out about what other people are doing, etc, especially by asking a lot of questions
a small plastic or metal tube that you can wrap wet hair around in order to make it curly
having a lot of curls or a curved shape
a small dried grape, used in cakes, etc.
a small black, red or white berry that grows in bunches on bushes
a curse (= an offensive word that is used to express extreme anger)
a powerful drug that makes you feel calm and relaxed or puts you to sleep. There are several types of barbiturate.
a substance that is used as an anaesthetic, and also as a drug that is taken illegally for pleasure
the leaves of a plant that grows in Arabia and Africa, which people put in the mouth and chew or drink in tea as a drug
writing that is done with a pen or pencil, not printed or typed
a person’s particular style of writing in this way
used when you are describing a situation in which there are signs that something is going to have problems or that it is going to be a failure
appearing rude because very few words are used, or because something is done in a very quick way
a piece of cloth that is hung to cover a window
a very thin piece of cloth that you hang at a window and that allows light to enter but stops people outside from being able to see inside
a piece of cloth that is hung up as a screen in a room or around a bed, for example
a piece of thick, heavy cloth that hangs in front of the stage in the theatre
a thing that covers, hides or protects something
to be a situation without hope or that you cannot escape from
to finish or mark the end of something
that looks or feels hard and tough like leather
not willing to be helpful
a thing that you do often and almost without thinking, especially something that is hard to stop doing
usual behaviour
a strong need to keep using drugs, alcohol or cigarettes regularly
a long piece of clothing worn by a monk or nun
if you do something from or out of force of habit, you do it without thinking about it and in a particular way because you have always done it that way in the past
a way of doing something; the use of a theory or a belief in a practical way
in the habit of doing something
if something is customary, it is what people usually do in a particular place or situation
typical of a particular person
typical, usual or ordinary; what you would expect
physically and mentally healthy
in the way that is normal or usual; as often happens
pretty and attractive
sexually attractive
clever, sometimes in an annoying way because a person is trying to get an advantage for himself or herself
a person who believes that people only do things to help themselves, rather than for good or sincere reasons
a person who does not believe that something good will happen or that something is important
the belief that people only do things to help themselves, rather than for good or sincere reasons
the belief that something good will not happen or that something is not important
the fact of being willing to do something that might hurt other people, if you can gain some advantage
a growth containing liquid that forms in or on a person’s or an animal’s body and may need to be removed
used especially by and to young children, and often as a name, to mean ‘father’
silly, often in a way that is funny
very silly
to say or pronounce words clearly
to express an idea clearly and exactly
to make the sound of a word or letter in a particular way
to give a judgement, opinion or statement formally, officially or publicly
holding, expressing or connected with extreme or dangerous opinions
extremely enthusiastic
wood that has been cut into pieces to be used for burning in fires
intended to cheat somebody, usually in order to make money illegally
not honest; intending to trick people
a hot dish consisting of small pieces of meat that are cooked and served in a thick white sauce
a person who has escaped or is running away from somewhere and is trying to avoid being caught
a person who prepares or sells clothes made from fur
a person who believes that everything that is written in the scriptures (= holy books) of their religion is completely true
a person who follows very strictly the basic principles of any subject or ideology
having no purpose because there is no chance of success
that you can choose to do or have if you want to
using or chosen by election
having the power to elect
that you choose to have; that does not require immediate attention
that a student can choose
the amount of money that you owe to a bank when you have spent more money than is in your bank account; an arrangement that allows you to do this
a phrase that combines two words that seem to be the opposite of each other, for example a deafening silence
a person who controls the direction in which a boat or ship moves
a place where helicopters take off and land

the mark (- ) used to join two words together to make a new one, as in back-up, to show that a word has been divided between the end of one line and the beginning of the next, or to show that something is missing (as in short- and long-term)
the fact of putting people or things together, especially in order to show a contrast or a new relationship between them
weakness of character; behaviour that is not responsible
connected with saying goodbye, especially at a formal occasion
made up of parts or people that are very different from each other
so different from each other that they cannot be compared or cannot work together
strange, and not suitable in a particular situation
a young woman who is not married
a woman who needs help
a small purple fruit, like a plum
